questions.question: Label the parts of a bright field light microscope.

answer.Coarse focus knob: Adjusts the stage height for rough focus
answer.Diaphragm: Regulates the amount of light on the specimen

questions.question: Compare and contrast the images produced by transmission and scanning electron microscopes.
questions.answer: TEM produces 2D images of internal structures; SEM produces 3D images of surface structures.

questions.question: A micrograph of a bacterium has a scale bar labeled '1 µm.' The bacterium appears to be 5 times the length of the scale bar. Estimate its actual size.
Explain the structure and function of prions, including their role in disease.
questions.answer: Prions are misfolded proteins that can induce other normal proteins to misfold, causing diseases like Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease.

questions.question: Describe the structural differences between viruses and bacteria.
questions.answer: Viruses are acellular, lack a cell wall, and require a host for replication; bacteria are cellular, have a cell wall, and can reproduce independently.

questions.question: Which of the following organisms has a cell wall composed of pseudopeptidoglycan?
Match the microbe to its primary characteristic:
Draw and label the following bacterial shapes: rods (bacilli), spheres (cocci), and spirals (spirochetes).
questions.answer: Bacilli are rod-shaped, cocci are spherical, and spirochetes are spiral-shaped bacteria.

questions.question: Write out the steps of a Gram stain procedure.
questions.answer: The Gram-positive bacteria appear purple, and Gram-negative bacteria appear pink after the procedure.

questions.question: Explain the key differences between Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
questions.answer: Gram-positive bacteria have a thick peptidoglycan layer and no outer membrane, while Gram-negative bacteria have a thin peptidoglycan layer and an outer membrane with lipopolysaccharides.
